sect2.title: Getting files
sect2.para: Latest releases can be always downloaded from WinMerge homepage: WinMerge.org. Note that there may be some delay updating homepages for releases, but project statuspage at SourceForge.net shows latest files. There is also mailing-list for release announcements. Stable releases are also available in several file download sites.
WinMerge can be installed using installer or by unzipping files from archive.

sect2.title: Using installer (recommended)
sect2.para: This is recommeded for most users. Installer asks location where WinMerge is installed, installs files, configures shell integration and adds WinMerge to Start-menu. To install WinMerge:

listitem.para: Select location for WinMerge and select Next-button. It is recommended to install WinMerge in own directory.

Select components installed or one of preconfigured combinations. Typical configuration is recommended for most users. In addition to components already selected by Typical, language file(s) could be choosed. Components are:
WinMerge core files - cannot be unselected - WinMerge executable files
Application Runtimes - cannot be unselected - needed DLL files
User's Guide - HTML user guide/manual - if it is not installed WinMerge opens manual from WinMerge.org
Languages - WinMerge translation files. After installing translation file user interface language can be selected from menu View/Language.
Select Start-menu folder or disable creating it.

Select additional tasks:
Enable Explorer context menu integration - Enables basic WinMerge shell integration (can be later enabled from options).
Integrate with TortoiseCVS - sets WinMerge to TortoiseCVS diff application.
Create a Desktop Icon - adds WinMerge icon to Desktop
Create a Quick Launch Icon - adds WinMerge icon to Quick Launch bar
Verify install selections and select Install button to continue.
After installer has copied files final screen appears with two checkboxes asking if created WinMerge Start-menu folder should be opened and if WinMerge application should be started.

sect2.title: Unzipping from archive
sect2.para: This is for experienced users. Archive files are smaller to download and faster to install.

WinMerge is pretty much independent from other system components. WinMerge doesn't integrate tightly to Windows or use lots of dlls. WinMerge[U].exe itself is dependent of MFC42[U].dll (and MSVCRT.dll) in addition to some system DLLs. So if mentioned DLLs already are installed to system, only WinMerge[U].exe is needed to run WinMerge.

sect2.title: Shell integration
sect2.para: Choose "Enable Explorer context menu integration" from installer's additional features to install shell integration.
If install program is not used, shell integration dll (ShellExtension.dll) must be registered separately. This is done by running register.bat from WinMerge directory.

Updating shell integreation outside installer requires first uninstalling current version. Uninstalling can be done by running uninstall.bat from WinMerge directory. After that computer should be restarted so Windows completes uninstallation. Then new version can be installed like described above.

sect2.title: 7-Zip and archive support
sect2.para: Archive file support in WinMerge requires 7-Zip. WinMerge installer does not install 7-Zip. 7-Zip installer can be downloaded from 7-Zip.org.

WinMerge automatically detects installed 7-zip in system, there is no need to any configuration. But WinMerge supports only certain versions of 7-Zip. Please check 7-zip version compatibility from Read Me.rft-file.

7-zip integration needs compatible Merge7z*.dll in WinMerge program directory. * comes from 7-zip version installed. For example 7-zip version 3.13 needs Merge7z313.dll. And if WinMergeU.exe (unicode version) is used, then "U" is also added to filename: Merge7z313U.dll. Merge7z*.dll files for compatible 7-zip versions are installed by WinMerge installer. If needed dll file is for some reason missing it can be copied to WinMerge directory, for example from zip-archive downloadable in WinMerge download page.

If Merge7z*.dll file is missing, WinMerge informs user with message showing filename of needed file and recommended version of 7-zip. This message can also be opened from Help-menu item "Archive Support Disabled".
